Hero.subtitle: A culinary voyage to the Imperial City of Hue, balancing{br}boldness and refinement in a single bowl.

Narrative.label: The Narrative
Narrative.title: Where imperial tradition meets modern{br}refinement.
Narrative.paragraph_1: Derived from the royal court cuisine of the Nguyen Dynasty, this dish—known as Bun Bo Hue—is a harmonious blend of spicy, sour, salty, and sweet. It stands as a testament to the culinary complexity of Central Vietnam, offering a profile far more robust than its northern counterpart, Pho.
Narrative.paragraph_2: The soul of the dish lies in its broth. We simmer premium beef shanks and pork knuckles for twelve hours with crushed lemongrass stalks and a hint of fermented shrimp paste. This meticulous process extracts deep umami notes while maintaining a clarity that is characteristic of high-end Vietnamese gastronomy.
Narrative.paragraph_3: Served with thick, cylindrical rice vermicelli and finished with our house-made chili saté, each bowl is a tribute to the Perfume River's misty mornings. It is not just soup; it is history poured into porcelain.
Narrative.pairing_desc: "The crisp acidity and mineral notes of this Alsatian Riesling cut through the rich, spicy broth, cleansing the palate while complementing the lemongrass aromatics."

Composition.label: The Composition
Composition.item_1_desc: Thick, cylindrical rice noodles with a satisfying chew, traditional to Central Vietnam.
Composition.item_2_desc: Freshly harvested stalks that impart the signature citrus-floral aroma to the broth.
Composition.item_3_desc: A traditional condiment that provides the essential umami foundation of the dish.

Cinematic.label: Perspective 02
Cinematic.title: The Art of the Broth
Cinematic.description: A visual study of the twelve-hour simmered lemongrass essence, captured at the moment of peak flavor extraction.

Journey.title: The Journey of Flavor
Journey.paragraph_1: Founded in the heart of the capital in 1994, Au Lac began as a humble tribute to the ancestral roots of Vietnamese cuisine. Named after the historic kingdom of the Lac Viet people, our eatery was envisioned as a bridge between the ancient traditions of the East and the refined techniques of contemporary gastronomy.
Journey.paragraph_2: For three decades, we have remained committed to the "trầm ấm" philosophy—creating a warm, soul-stirring atmosphere where every dish tells a story of heritage. What started with a single family recipe for Pho has evolved into an editorial dining experience that honors the seasonal rhythm of our land.
Journey.quote: "We do not just serve food; we preserve the echoes of a thousand years of culinary evolution."
Journey.paragraph_3: Today, Au Lac stands as a beacon of Vietnamese fine dining, where the crackle of a clay pot and the aroma of star anise serve as a homecoming for the senses.

Philosophy.label: Our Core Values
Philosophy.title: Culinary Philosophy
Philosophy.value_1_desc: Honoring the slow techniques of our ancestors. From 24-hour bone broths to hand-ground spices using the mortar and pestle.
Philosophy.value_2_desc: Elevating heritage flavors through precision, artistic plating, and a sophisticated global perspective on fine dining.

Founders.label: The Visionaries
Founders.title: Meet the Founders
Founders.paragraph_1: Chef Nguyen and Master Sommelier Linh founded Au Lac with a shared dream: to redefine how the world perceives Vietnamese hospitality.
Founders.paragraph_2: With backgrounds spanning from the street stalls of Saigon to Michelin-starred kitchens in Paris, they bring a balanced harmony of warmth and professional excellence to every guest's table.
Founders.quote: "The table is where culture lives. We invite you to sit with us."
